Namespace: context

tem. context

Contains functions for determining information about the context a dashboard/wizard is running in (i.e. Console version, preferred language, and whether it is running in the Console or as a web report).
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 2223

Methods

<static> getBaseDirectory

Gets the absolute path to where the dashboard is being loaded from for applications running in the Console. In Web Reports it returns the base href for report files.
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 2405
Returns:
Type
String

<static> getCurrentDSN

Not available in Web Reports Returns a string containing the DSN name that the console is using to connect to the database. No error diagnostics are provided as this function does not have any expected error conditions.
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 2245
Returns:
String containing the DSN name that the console is using to connect to the database.
Type
String

<static> getCurrentUser

Not available in Web Reports Returns a string containing the database login name that the console is using to connect to the database. No error diagnostics are provided as this function does not have any expected error conditions.

<static> getPreferredLanguage

Available in: TEM 8.1+ Used to return language specified by "Console language" dropdown in File < Preferences in the Console (ie ENU, CHS, JPN, ESN, ITA, FRA, DEU)
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 2267

Type

<static> getUserLocale

Returns user locale. If running in an 8.1+ Console that supports selecting a preferred language from the "Console language" dropdown in File < Preferences, and a preferred language is selected it will default to that, otherwise it will use navigator.browserLanguage or window.navigator.language to determine locale.

Note: Even though different browsers may return the locale as xx-XX as opposed to xx-xx, this function always normalized the locale as xx-xx

Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 2320
Returns:
Locale in format xx-xx
Type
String

Gets version of Console/Web reports an application is running in.
